channel.title: Getting Your Money's Worth with Judith West, Vlog
channel.description: "Getting Your Money's Worth", the new TV talk show hosted by Judith West, a well-known New York manufacturer and longtime guest on other TV and radio talkshows, is about added value for your dollars and your life.

image.title: Getting Your Money's Worth with Judith West
image.description: "Getting Your Money's Worth", the new TV talk show hosted by Judith West, a well-known New York manufacturer and longtime guest on other TV and radio talkshows, is about added value for your dollars and your life.

item.title: Tips for Applying for Student Aid
item.description: Getting your money's worth advises: be careful when filing for student aid. Understand that nearly everyone, regardless of circumstances, is eligible for aid from the $8,000 plus program....

item.title: Who Saw Wall Street Debacle in Advance
item.description: We're told that our economy is in a slow recovery. I guess that's akin to being off "life support". But lots of us are still angry....

item.title: Tips on Investing from Warren Buffett
item.description: Warren Buffett, America's most famous investor, is confident. And he's on a buying spree. He used the past eighteen months to pick up value....

item.title: Extended Product Warranties
item.description: Just say "no" to an extended product warranty. They are a bad deal....

item.title: More Job Hunters Than Jobs
item.description: There are more job hunters than jobs. So during an interview avoid even a minor slip of the tongue....

item.title: Nothing Replaces Face-to-Face
item.description: I don't know if you noticed, but of late, more and more emails have those smiley faces showing up in the message....

item.title: Secrets to a Happily Married Man
item.description: February is the month for lovers. So this is a wife's "to do" list for her husband....

item.title: NY State Debt, National Debt, Your Debt
item.description: This is about your owing money, lots of it. According to our city comptroller, you are in debt to the tune of seventy-seven hundred dollars....

item.title: Too Much House
item.description: For too many years, too many people bought too much house. How to avoid?...

item.title: Ruth McBride Jordan, A Remarkable Mother
item.description: Ruth McBride Jordan died in the early days of January. Her name may not ring a bell, but her son's book, A BLACK MAN'S TRIBUTE TO HIS WHITE MOTHER, was on the NEW YORK TIMES best seller list for 100 weeks....

item.title: Teen Takes Family Conflict to Facebook
item.description: Tess, a 15 year old when grounded for drinking and missing her curfew by an hour, took to Facebook to complain. She organized an advocacy group of over 1,000 teens to protest her punishment....

item.title: Just Google!
item.description: I traveled over the holiday internationally so was subjected to the new security coming back to the U.S....

item.title: Memory Loss?
item.description: The average American consumes thirty-four gigabytes of data each day. That's the equivalent of about 100,000 words both read and heard....

item.title: Kids Should Come First
item.description: Secretary of Education Arne Duncan has hundreds of millions of dollars to dispense in Race to the Top grants. This money is meant to encourage education innovation....

item.title: Little White Lies
item.description: The NEW YORK TIMES says there are lies, damned lies and lies you tell your spouse....

item.description: What are your top pet peeves? METRO NEW YORK asked New Yorker's theirs....
